channel.title: Comments on: Simplest Possible Plugin Manager For Rails

item.title: by: Walker
item.description: What I want to do on my blog, is every few hours take the oldest post and move it to the front of the queue, all automatically. Anyone know if there is a plugin that can do this or a simple way to set up another plugin to do this (use my own feed perhaps)? Thanks.

item.title: by: Duane Johnson
item.description:
Looks like some of the svn repositories are down (or moved). In that case, you have to 'unsource' them. Here's what worked for me:

ruby script/plugin unsource http://svn.protocool.com/rails/plugins/ ruby script/plugin unsource http://svn.substance-it.co.uk/public/plugins/ ruby script/plugin unsource http://homepage.ntlworld.com/easley/plugins/ ruby script/plugin unsource http://elitists.textdriven.com/svn/plugins/

item.title: by: Roland
item.description:
Hi,

I tried to use the plugin manager which is now part of the standard Rails package. Unfortunately it does not seem to work:

$ ./plugin list svn: PROPFIND request failed on '/svn/rails/plugins' svn: PROPFIND of '/svn/rails/plugins': could not connect to server (http://dev.rubyonrails.com)

Any ideas?
item.content:encoded:

item.title: by: Ryan Tomayko
item.description: I wanted to mention that you can put plugin anywhere on your PATH (e.g., /usr/local/bin, /home/you/bin, etc.) and it will search up from the current directory (`pwd` not `$0`) for a Rails environment. So you can just run plugin instead of ./script/plugin or whatever.
item.content:encoded: I wanted to mention that you can put plugin anywhere on your PATH (e.g., /usr/local/bin, /home/you/bin, etc.) and it will search up from the current directory (`pwd` not `$0`) for a Rails environment. So you can just run plugin instead of ./script/plugin or whatever.
